text:
Apple suddenly became friends with Valve. They will make an AR helmet together
04 Nov 2019, 12:51 by Artyom Bausov
DigiTimes reports that Apple has begun to partner with the gaming company Valve. They will create an augmented reality helmet.
The assembly will be responsible for Quanta and Pegatron. Announcement of new items may take place next summer at WWDC 2020.
Valve released the first VR headset back in 2015, but Apple is set to make an advanced brand new device. Tim Cook believes that AR can make digital content a part of the world of users and will become as popular among consumers as smartphones.
Earlier, analyst Min-Chi Kuo claimed that Apple's AR helmet production will start in the fourth quarter of 2019. [MacRumors]
